title: (13195) Valverde -

The parking lot is quiet with plenty of shade, there is a water fountain nearby and toilets, which are occasionally open... impressive views of both the castle and De la Vega of the Guadiana river, nearby are hiking trails to Valverde and its lagoon for example! A good place to spend the night, we went in the van, and everything was perfect.

title: (13195) Poblete -

The town is a 1 minute walk where there are neighborhood shops, restaurants, tapas bars, bakery, etc. There is also a natural area with barbecues and tables, a pond with ducks and drinking water and where you can sleep.

title: (13190) Corral de Calatrava - Calle Almadén

title: (13270) Camping Los Arenales Almagro
description: Well located very shady place with big trees. The place has a lot of potential which unfortunately is not used. Sanitary okay, plots partly dirty and neglected. Cafeteria permanently closed, restaurants closed (Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday...). Nice pool with bar (bar very expensive). Bread service was offered but didn't take place the next morning. In this condition, the place is only suitable for transit as a self-catering.

The place is worth it. In summer it has a beach bar to eat or drink something very well priced.

title: (13250) Daimiel - 30 Paseo Carmen
description: Station service in Daimiel signposted by Cepsa where motorhomes are welcome. It has a car park, black and gray water drainage areas, and drinking water filling. Sale of butane and propane, firewood and biomass. It has a free shower for guests and a cafeteria. Very clean bathrooms with breastfeeding area. Shop with local products. The owner has another low cost gas station next to this one with great fuel discounts and a wash area. You can park and sleep without problem in one of its esplanades.

title: (13360) Granátula de Calatrava - Cam. de la Aldea del Rey
title_short: (13360) Granátula de Calatrava - Cam. de la Aldea del Rey
description: Very quiet car park day/night. Gravel and asphalt leveling. To sleep you don't hear anything except the sound of nature. Next to an archaeological site of good cultural tourist interest and a Roman bridge (Publio baebio). It has a playground, picnic areas and garbage containers. The town is 4 km away and has all the services (pharmacies, bakeries, bars, tobacconists, grocery stores, banks). The environment is surrounded by olive and almond trees.

address.street: Cam. de la Aldea del Rey
